body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

I am using the Example 2 powershell script which is given in the URL https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.utility/write-progress?view=powershell-7.2. In earlier version, the title Outerloop and Innerloop displays and I have seen it in previous releases.  I have also used it in other scripts where it used to appear.

With latest 7.2.4 version, the CurrentOperation value is not displayed.  I am able to consistently reproduce with the example as well as my own script where it used to work earlier
[ProgressBar.txt](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/8950591/ProgressBar.txt)

The following screenshot also shows the way it displays on my Powershell terminal
![CurrentOperationNotDisplayed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24926263/174847374-f7bc6d40-2570-4bca-959b-65263c96008f.PNG)



### Expected behavior

```console
-CurrentOperation value should be displayed when the script executes
```


### Actual behavior

```console
-CurrentOperation is not displayed
```

_No response_

comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT - the WG is not sure whether the CurrentOperation is supposed to be shown in the minimal style. Could you please take a look at this and let us know? We also noticed some aberrant behavior when comparing behavior between platforms.

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body:
> noticed some aberrant behavior when comparing behavior between platforms

Specifically, the macOS progress bar rendering appears to be correct, as is the conhost.exe rendering on Windows.  But in Windows Terminal, neither progress bar appears to advance and they never reach anywhere close to 100%. I see the same problem in Ubuntu/WSL in Windows Terminal.

title: CurrentOperation value is not displayed when provided along with Write-Progress
